revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix (2), SK SK hynix → SK hynix (2)
revision.text:

|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24K |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 400 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = Serial |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Macronix;MX25L6405DMI-12G;cFeon EN25P64; |flash1size = 8 |flash1maxsize = 7995392 |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 64 |ram1chip = SK hynix;HY5DU121622DTP-D43;MX B102331 25L6405DMI-12G 3D492200;winbond W942566EN-5; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = 32 |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Realtek;RTL8306SD; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3/3u |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 68:7F:74 |oui = 68:7F:74 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = U-Boot;1.1.7;; |stockos = |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = Yes |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes |jtag = yes |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = CyberTAN |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT,OpenWrt |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 01/08/2010 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = 745883589401 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B003BEE6ZC |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 7.98" x 6.27" x 1.3" |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1chip2 = Atheros;AR9102; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== FCC photos show the device with the 32MB '''[[Winbond]]''' W9425G6EH-5. The OpenWrt wiki states the device uses the 64MB '''[[SK hynix]]''' HY5DU121622DTP-D43 (and 8MB Macronix MX25L6405DMI-12G Flash). {{seealso|Linksys WRT160NL}} ==Links of Interest== [http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/linksys/e2100l On the OpenWrt wiki]
[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=73986 On the DD-WRT forums]
[https://svn.dd-wrt.com//changeset/15174 Support started]
[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linksys_routers Listed on the 'Linksys routers' page on Wikipedia] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== v.24 SP2 - build 14935 - 20100812 You will first need to download this file for the flashing. ftp://ftp.dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/2011/02-17-11-r16214/linksys_E2100L/e2100l-firmware.bin # Go into the linksys stock firmware and choose to reset to defaults. # Once that is finished, set a static ip on your machine to 192.168.1.6 with subnet 255.255.255.0 and gateway 192.168.1.1 # Log back into the linksys firmware and find where to update the firmware. # Select the file linked above and then begin the flash procedure, this usually takes 6-7 minutes for it to finish properly, so be patient! # Once it is finished, close your browser, then reopen and browse to http://192.168.1.1 it should want you to set a user/password, do so. # When you are in dd-wrt's webgui, go to Administration > Factory Defaults # Select to "Restore Factory Defaults" This will effectively hard reset the router and ensure integrity of the flash. # Log back into the webgui @ http://192.168.1.1 and set a user/pass and enjoy dd-wrt! * Should you want to use DHCP you then may want to unset the static ip from your machine. ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/linksys/linksys_e2100l_10 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/e2100l |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?pid=120791\ |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = ? |current_supported_version = ? |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==Reverting== ===Reverting dd-wrt=== Should you want to revert back to stock firmware then you should be able to download the stock firmware from Linksys's site and flash back using the webgui. ==Pictures==
